title: The Color Wizard
description: A wizard with a very high nearsight prescription loses their glasses... they can't find their way, but maybe you could help?
highlights: Made for the 'Mini game a month' game jam from May 2024, where you need to create a short but sweet game in one month.
The theme for this game jam was 'Wizard', and we wanted to create a story of a wizard that uses colors as their spells.
The game is set only in one screen, and the camera does not move. The player can see the whole map at all times.
Really pretty artwork, created by @wydes17 on instagram!

title: Catastrophia
description: You're a cat in the midst of a robot-alien invasion. Survive and collect food!
highlights: Winners of the Patient73 2024 Game Jam.
One of the objectives of the development of this game was to showcase how the use of AI can help in the creation of games and concepts.
The second objective was to give visibility to rare diseases, and make a fun game kids with rare diseases can enjoy while in the hospitals. This is why WebGL was a must.

title: Demo: Shooter 2D
highlights: Made for a course project, in which we had to think of mechanics for ourselves, apart from implementing some given to us.
Mechanics implemented: A key-door system, enemy 'horde' spawning, shooting, double jump and 'bouncy' platforms.
The project was also created to practice simple animation.

title: Demo: Medical Showdown
description: My final project for the Higher Certificate. Small platformer game made in HTML Superpowers, an HTML game framework.
highlights: My first taste of 'gamedev'. It's very buggy, but I was proud of being able to finish it!
Had also only around 1 month to create it, in the middle of 2020.
